item.title: Best Open-World Games That Focus On Skill Over RNG
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games vary in their use of RNG, with titles like Far Cry 5 emphasizing skill over luck.
  • Games like Rain World and Battle Brothers prioritize player skill and strategy over RNG for survival.
  • Elden Ring focuses on skill-based combat, rewarding patience and attention to detail over luck.

There are a great number of open-world games that make frequent use of RNG both in and out of combat. This is particularly noticeable in open-world games with random loot tables, often encouraging repetitive gameplay that can quickly become tiresome.

However, there remain plenty of open-world titles that use RNG sparingly. That said, there are also several open-world titles that, while full of RNG, remain decidedly skill-based experiences. These titles vary in their use of RNG, but all focus their efforts on providing opportunities for skill expression.

Far Cry 5

Expressive Action In An Open World

Far Cry 5
9 /10
22
7.9 /10
Released
March 27, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

While perhaps not the most difficult of open-world games, Far Cry 5 - like many if not all of the games in its franchise - requires more skill than luck. This is thanks to its nature as a first-person shooter, ensuring players are always relying on their reflexes and aim over anything else.

However, Far Cry also allows players to approach combat encounters in multiple ways. This facilitates frequently dynamic gunfights that test player tactics almost as much as their skill with typical FPS game mechanics.

Kenshi

A Slow-Burning & Dangerous RPG

Kenshi
10.0 /10
Released
December 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Powered by

Kenshi is an open-world sandbox with an emphasis on detailed RPG character progression and player agency. In the game, players can exercise freedom in a multitude of ways, setting their own goals and achieving them however they see fit.

However, achieving these goals is rarely easy, as everything in Kenshi can take a great deal of both time and effort. What's more, the world of Kenshi is remarkably dangerous, packed with unpredictable and utterly dynamic denizens and factions that frequently ask players to rely on themselves.

Rain World

Exploration Of A Dangerous Ecosystem

Rain World
7.8 /10
Released
March 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Tobacco Reference
Powered by

Rain World is an utterly precise experience, offering players a singular vision painted in mechanical detail. While its gameplay is relatively simple on the surface, Rain World 's combination of exploration and survival is biting, and it can take time to get to grips with its unique learning curve.

In the game, players must navigate a dynamic ecosystem via simple 2D-platformer controls. However, Rain World places players at the near-bottom of the food chain. As a result, players must rely on their own skills, rather than RNG, to survive.

Blood West

A Dynamic Combination Of Stealth & Action

Blood West
FPS
Stealth
RPG
Systems
Released
February 10, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Blood West is an open-world FPS with an emphasis on stealth, taking inspiration from the immersive-sim genre by granting players a great deal of agency in how they approach combat. While freeing, this agency also requires players to make careful plans.

It's no good just having a solid plan, though; players will also need to execute their plan with precision if they're to overcome the often overwhelming odds. The inherent challenges of the FPS genre can also be present here, with players having to rely on solid aim and fast reflexes in order to survive.

Battle Brothers

A Brutal Sandbox RPG

Battle Brothers
Indie Games
Tactical
RPG
Strategy
Adventure
Systems
Released
April 27, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Battle Brothers is a strategy game at heart, but set in an open world that supports its RPG systems. This title tasks players with running a mercenary company, fighting in gruesome turn-based battles, and completing various contracts for folks across the land.

There's plenty of challenge in Battle Brothers , and while chance can play its cruel game plenty, those who exercise smart strategies and clever tactics are more likely to thrive. Furthermore, Battle Brothers supports a wide variety of playstyles for players to experiment with, allowing for a great deal of expression.

Elden Ring

A Skill-Based Gauntlet

Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Elden Ring is an impressive and ambitious open-world RPG developed by FromSoftware and shares plenty of DNA with their Dark Souls games. Players can expect to face plenty of challenges here, especially with the game's myriad bosses.

And this challenge comes not from RNG, but from a skill-based combat system that requires time and effort to master. Painstakingly telegraphed attack patterns, in particular, help Elden Ring to focus on skill over luck, ensuring patience and attention to detail are rewarded above all else.

Caves Of Qud

An Expressive Roguelike RPG

Caves Of Qud
Roguelike
RPG
Systems
Released
July 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Caves Of Qud is a relatively inaccessible but incredibly deep open-world RPG, providing a sharp edge with its roguelike structure. While RNG is abundant and an important factor in the game's design, survival in Caves Of Qud often comes down to tact and resourcefulness.

Managing both resources and ability cooldowns is almost as important as careful planning and threat assessment, all of which are useful in preventing RNG from ending any given run. As a result, Caves Of Qud manages to blend both RNG and skill-based gameplay.

item.title: Pokemon GO Teases New 'Tales of Transformation' Season
item.description:
Pokemon GO has officially dropped the first teaser for the game's upcoming "Tales of Transformation" season, set to introduce multiple popular Pokemon variants to the game. The massively popular monster-catching mobile game has seen a busy summer with Niantic bringing a plethora of new content to the game throughout the past few months. Pokemon GO has introduced multiple new Pokemon during the summer, including the Snom and Honedge evolutionary lines and recently adding Eternatus with the Pokemon GO Fest: Max Finale event. Now, fans won't have to wait much longer for Pokemon GO 's next season.

Pokemon GO 's recent Max Finale event is expected to serve as a grand send-off to the game's focus around the Galar region throughout the past year. Recent events have introduced both the Crowned variants of Pokemon Sword and Shield box Legendaries Zacian and Zamazenta, alongside Max Finale's recent introduction of Eternatus. Pokemon GO also added the Dynamax and Gigantamax mechanic from the eighth generation of Pokemon games, allowing Pokemon to grow both in size and power. Pokemon GO is now gearing up to kick off an exciting new season for the Fall months.

Pokemon GO officially revealed the upcoming "Tales of Transformation" season Sunday evening through its official social media channels. The teaser trailer features silhouettes of several new Pokemon coming throughout the next season, including Mega Metagross and Gigantamax Eevee among the highlights. The video also hints at a new variant for a pre-existing Mythical Pokemon, with fans expected to be able to acquire Keldeo's Resolute Form during the new season. Pokemon GO confirmed the timeframe for Tales of Transformation as well, with the season kicking off on September 2 and running until December 2.

Pokemon GO Teases New Tales of Transformation Season

  • September 2, 2025 - December 2, 2025
  • New Pokemon : Mega Metagross, Gigantamax Eevee, Resolute Form Keldeo

Tales of Transformation looks to be an exciting season for Pokemon GO as the game leaves behind the Max Finale event. Pokemon GO has seen several rumors about future content coming to the game, with multiple ninth-generation Pokemon like Ogerpon, Terapagos, and Pecharunt rumored to be added. Niantic has already confirmed one new ninth-generation Pokemon coming to the game soon as well, with the upcoming "Sunkissed Shores" event adding Dondozo to Pokemon GO .

Pokemon GO fans should have lots to be excited about with a new Mega Evolution and Gigantamax variant on the way. Metagross is already considered a strong option for many players within Pokemon GO , even without its Mega Evolution added to the game. Keldeo is also seen as an effective Attacker in both in PvP and PvE content, thanks in part to its access to Sacred Sword as a powerful Fighting-type Charged Attack. Tales of Transformation looks to have plenty of major content in store to provide a fun Fall season for Pokemon GO .

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Best Co-Op Games For Exploring A Large World Together
item.description:
Summary

  • Co-op exploration in games like Conan Exiles and No Man's Sky encourages autonomy and teamwork at the same time.
  • Games like Ghost Recon Wildlands and Sea of Thieves provide reactive, non-linear, and unpredictable experiences.
  • Deep Rock Galactic and Minecraft emphasize exploration through co-op with procedurally generated caves and endless landscapes.

Some games are built for glory, some are built for mayhem, and then there are those that feel tailor-made for gathering one's crew, venturing out into the unknown, and discovering something strange, beautiful, or downright terrifying in a sprawling world. Co-op exploration is more than just traveling together.

It’s about navigating dynamic environments, improvising in the face of chaos, and experiencing awe with someone else, often while one of said players is accidentally setting everything on fire. Here's a look at some of the best co-op video game worlds that are large, layered, and always better when shared .

Valheim

If Vikings Had GPS, It Would Ruin The Whole Vibe

Valheim
8.7 /10
Released
February 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
r
Powered by

Every time a group of players sets sail in Valheim , there’s a 70 percent chance it will end in a shipwreck, wolf attacks, or someone forgetting their pants. And yet, that’s what makes exploration in this world so satisfying. Inspired by Norse mythology and built with semi-procedural terrain, Valheim offers a surprisingly vast landscape comprising various biomes, each with its own unique threats, resources, and boss battles. Players must work together not just to survive, but to make the unknown feel habitable.

What starts as chopping trees around a meadow's base eventually leads to scouting swamps, hunting across mountains, and braving misty lands that hide things no one is ready for. Longboats become lifelines, and building outposts on distant shores starts to feel like colonizing a myth. Exploration isn’t passive; it’s something players prepare for with food buffs, mead, and a collective plan that always goes sideways. And when it does, it’s all the better for it. Because Valheim ’s world feels hand-crafted by the gods, only teamwork makes it feel conquerable.

Conan Exiles

Teamwork Makes The Barbarism Dream Work

Conan Exiles
Survival
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
May 8, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Nudity, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

The Exiled Lands are massive, hostile, and extremely weird. In Conan Exiles , players start nearly naked and alone in the desert, but once a few allies join the server, that lonely survival grind turns into an expedition of bloody conquest and base-building on a scale that puts most MMOs to shame. The map is loaded with temples, ruins, dungeons, and twisted landmarks from the Hyborian Age, each hiding rare materials or monsters with names that sound like they crawled out of a Lovecraft notebook.

Co-op isn’t just useful here; it’s survival. One person handles construction, another scouts for thralls, and a third gets into an accidental fight with a sandstorm god. The real joy of exploring Conan Exiles together is how much autonomy it gives each player to specialize while still encouraging massive group efforts. Whether it's building a fortress on a cliffside or sailing upriver to find ancient vaults, the world is unforgiving, but it opens up like a scroll when tackled with the right squad.

Ghost Recon Wildlands

Bolivia Never Stood A Chance

Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands
8 /10
7.7 /10
Released
March 7, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Stadia
Powered by

When Ubisoft decided to set Ghost Recon Wildlands in an open-world version of Bolivia, they weren’t kidding about scale. It’s one of the largest maps Ubisoft has ever made, stitched together with deserts, jungles, salt flats, mountains, and narco-controlled outposts that stretch across every biome. It’s also one of the best examples of tactical co-op fused with freeform exploration, where a squad of four can spend hours sneaking, driving, parachuting, and sometimes just crashing helicopters in spectacularly dumb ways.

What makes Wildlands work as a co-op explorer is how reactive and non-linear everything is. Players can approach any mission from any angle, scout enemy bases with drones, or simply drive into the chaos while someone blares music from the car speakers. Between the cartel intel pickups and hidden weapon caches scattered across the country, there’s always a reason to take the long way around. And when someone calls in a chopper and somehow lands it on top of a burning gas station, no one asks why. It’s Wildlands . That’s just how the world rolls.

No Man's Sky

A Universe Shared Is A Universe That Feels Less Lonely

5 Images
5 Images
No Man's Sky
7 /10
62
9.3 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Animated Blood
Developer(s)
Hello Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC, Nintendo Switch 2
Powered by

Back when No Man’s Sky launched, many people joked that it was an empty universe. But now, years later, it might be one of the most content-rich co-op exploration games ever made. Every planet, star system, and derelict freighter is procedurally generated, and thanks to full multiplayer integration, players can experience all of it together. That means landing on a planet with floating jellyfish trees and acid rain and immediately arguing over whether to build a base or keep moving.

Exploration is not just vertical and horizontal. It’s dimensional. Players can fly from atmosphere to orbit in real-time, jump between galaxies, and even dock at mysterious space anomalies that act like hubs for dozens of other gamers. It’s the kind of game where one person becomes obsessed with collecting alien pets, while another builds a trade empire across three systems. Co-op makes it feel more grounded and more purposeful, especially when the team is scanning wildlife together or escaping a sentinel ambush by the skin of their spaceship’s teeth.

Sea Of Thieves

The Open Sea Was Never This Hilarious Or This Dangerous

Sea of Thieves
7.7 /10
Released
March 20, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Crude Humor, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Rare
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

There are moments in Sea of Thieves when everything goes quiet. The sea is calm, the sky is red with the sunset, and the crew is singing while someone checks the map. Then, five minutes later, that same crew will be set on fire, screaming, taking on water, being chased by a megalodon, and realizing that no one dropped anchor. That’s the beauty of it. Sea of Thieves offers a wide open sea filled with shipwrecks, skeleton forts, ancient shrines, and floating bottles that lead to cursed treasure, but it’s the unpredictability that makes co-op exploration unforgettable.

The map is massive but entirely unmarked. There are no waypoints or dotted lines; there are just islands, riddles, and the hope that someone can read a compass. Having a full crew onboard transforms navigation into an orchestral performance of shouting and laughter, especially during storms or when cannonballs start flying from behind a rock. And because every other ship on the ocean is another group of real players, exploration always comes with the potential for betrayal, alliance, or pure chaos. The open world is big, but the shared moments are always the biggest part of it.

Deep Rock Galactic

Leave No Dwarf Behind, Unless They’re The Ones Who Called The Swarm

Deep Rock Galactic
7.7 /10
Released
May 13, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen due to Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Developer(s)
Ghost Ship Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
Powered by

Exploration doesn’t always mean beauty and wonder. Sometimes, it’s about carving through pitch-black rock tunnels while fighting off a horde of alien bugs and yelling at one's engineer to place the zipline already. Deep Rock Galactic throws players into procedurally generated cave networks on Hoxxes 4, where the minerals are valuable, the danger is high, and the only things keeping the team alive are good communication and a decent flamethrower.

What makes Deep Rock Galactic special isn’t just the variety in its underground world but how tightly the co-op systems are designed around exploration itself. Each class is built to support mobility and discovery, whether it’s the driller opening new routes or the scout lighting up giant caverns with flare guns. No two expeditions feel the same, and players are constantly navigating terrain that shifts from crystalline beauty to panic-inducing darkness. It’s one of the few games where exploration feels like a job, and that’s said with complete love.

Minecraft

The World Is Only As Big As One's Imagination Is Loud

6 Images
6 Images
Minecraft
191
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Mojang
Platform(s)
3DS, Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PS Vita, Xbox One, Xbox 360
Powered by

What starts as punching a tree in Minecraft quickly becomes an expedition that never ends. This game isn’t just a big sandbox; it’s an endless canvas where every direction holds something unpredictable. Biomes stretch out for literal miles and are dotted with villages, strongholds, ocean monuments, and the occasional ill-fated lava pool that can claim someone who lagged behind. Whether playing on survival or creative mode, exploring in co-op isn’t just helpful; it’s how stories are made. One person digs straight down, another finds a pink sheep, and someone else gets lost in a cave system and re-emerges three real-life hours later.

There’s no set goal, which means that everything is dictated by group ambition. Those who want to raid an End City can get geared up and march across The End together. Want to build a rail system connecting ten continents? That's also been done. Exploration is made even richer through mods and servers that add biomes, mechanics, and even quests, turning Minecraft into a proper open-world RPG if that’s the vibe gamers want. It’s not about how big the world is. It’s about what four sleep-deprived people do when they find a desert temple and forget how to share loot.

item.title: Best Open-World Games For Feeling Like An OP Barbarian
item.description:
Summary

  • Achieve a barbaric feeling either via a specific "Barbarian" class in some games or through role-playing in others.
  • Assemble a barbarian army in games like Dragon's Dogma 2 and Conan Exiles .
  • Play as a barbarian in different games with specific builds, focusing on strength, aesthetically accurate armor, and powerful weaponry.

Barbarian is a word that has been used throughout history, usually to pejoratively describe a rival person or group who are perceived to be callous and brutish. Naturally, many video game players wish to unleash an animalistic side in the characters they control, utilizing large weapons and charging head-first into battle, evoking a sense of strength and power in the process.

In some cases, barbarian is a class that can be chosen, giving an extra boost to such characteristics, but there are other cases where players may successfully achieve their goal through role-playing. These are some of the best games for feeling like an overpowered barbarian, ranked based on a combination of their overall quality and popularity, plus how barbaric they make players feel.

Kingdoms Of Amalur: Re-Reckoning

Invest In Might As A Warrior

Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning
7 /10
8.0 /10
Released
September 8, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
38 Studios, Big Huge Games, KAIKO GmbH
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PC, PS4, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

One such game with no dedicated "Barbarian" class is Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning , but it is possible to replicate the feeling of one with the options available in the game. This remake of the underrated PS3 gem features all kinds of powerful Destiny options, determining the class of the protagonist, with their chosen race also giving bonuses to certain attributes.

The warlike nature of the Almain makes them the best race for any budding barbarian, but investing in the Might skill tree is a must regardless of race, starting as a simple Brawler and working toward Warlord. The Almain's smithing skills can be useful for crafting the right gear that enhances strength and close-quarters weaponry that makes the Fateless One a formidable opponent.

Dragon's Dogma 2

Assemble A Small Barbarian Army

Dragon's Dogma 2
9 /10
17
7.0 /10
Released
March 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

One of many games to feature a silent protagonist, Dragon's Dogma 2 is something of a rarity in that not only can the Arisen take on brutish qualities, but they can assemble their own barbarian horde. This can be achieved through the Pawn system, where players may apply the right vocation, armor sets, and weaponry to both themselves and their loyal followers.

Starting with the Fighter class, the Arisen may specialize in the use of melee weapons, but it is advisable to seek out and complete the “Vocation Frustration” quest in Vernworth to unlock the Warrior advanced class. Through this, two-handed greatswords and hammers may be wielded, ensuring highly impactful strikes that can knock down and finish off all foes.

The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

Barbarian Armor Set Boosts Attack

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
60
9.2 /10
Released
May 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated E for Everyone 10+ for Fantasy Violence and Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

It may seem a surprise that the cunning, sleek, and slender Link could pass as a somewhat coarse and merciless thug, but it is possible in The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom . Much like in its predecessor, the three pieces that form the Barbarian Set of armor can be found in caves around Hyrule, granting an attack boost and making him look appropriate for the role.

Upgrading the armor set at one of the Great Fairy Fountains grants a higher level of defense and reduces stamina drain when performing charge attacks. Combining this with large two-handed battleaxes, hammers, swords, or other armaments merged by the Fuse ability, Link can ruthlessly obliterate enemies with ease.

Monster Hunter World

Craft The Right Gear & Master Combat Mechanics

Monster Hunter World
10 /10
8.6 /10
Released
January 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

There is already something quite primitive about the feeling Monster Hunter World can evoke, much like the rest of the series. Hunting massive monsters, learning their habits and attack patterns, then smashing them repeatedly using raw power until they are defeated, brings out the primal nature of many players.

Since there is no leveling system in the traditional sense, becoming overpowered is largely down to mastering game mechanics and the cycle of defeating more powerful monsters to craft better gear, allowing even more mighty behemoths to be battled. Utilizing greatswords and hammers is best for unleashing brutal attacks that leave their mark and make players feel like an unstoppable force of nature.

Elden Ring

Great Build For Beginners

Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

While it may not make players entirely overpowered in Elden Ring with its difficult and intense combat, some find that the Barbarian build is a great starting point for newcomers to the game. Soulslike games often demand split-second timing for both attacks and defense, so this build is better for beginners to cause masses of damage without needing to worry about precision.

Focusing on improving vitality and endurance is the best approach, allowing more hits to be absorbed, plus finding weapons capable of bludgeoning foes in a few swings is helpful. It's a simple build that is easy to achieve and can be fun to play, but it can leave players unprotected against ranged attacks and even some bosses who punish those standing nearby.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Focus On Two-Handed & Light Armor

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
80
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

One of many very effective builds in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim , a barbarian-style Dragonborn is particularly strong in the early game and can remain so as the game progresses. Plenty of races offer viable options, but the best by far is Orc, due to their unique Berserker Rage ability and their increased skills with heavy armor, melee weapons, blocking, smithing, and enchanting.

All these skills are particularly handy for a barbaric figure, since they can craft and improve the right gear to be particularly devastating when charging headfirst into one or multiple opponents. Various enchantments on weapons and armor can improve health, stamina, and attack power, fortifying the barbarian way of life both in terms of aesthetics and combat tactics.

Diablo 4

Many Barbarian Builds On Offer

Diablo 4
9 /10
102
7.5 /10
Released
June 6, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Developer(s)
Blizzard
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

In what would arguably be one of the worst worlds to live in, a barbarian seems like the perfect character to roleplay for any hope of survival. Diablo 4 offers many potential builds in the Barbarian class, all of which generally focus on high strength and dexterity stats, combined with their high damage output and good survivability.

Various skills like Call of the Ancients and Whirlwind are especially powerful and particularly useful when taking on multiple enemies at once. Like many other games, Barbarian is a strong build for beginners that can remain strong throughout a playthrough, being particularly impressive in Nightmare Dungeons and against Uber bosses when built correctly.

Conan Exiles

Become A Barbarian In The World Of Conan

Conan Exiles
Survival
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
May 8, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Nudity, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Funcom
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Set during the Hyborian Age in the world of Conan the Barbarian, it makes sense that players can roleplay as such a character in Conan Exiles . Surviving and thriving in the Exiled Lands and beyond is tough, so it is necessary to scavenge for resources and make use of the strong base-building mechanics, potentially even taking human NPCs as thralls to work in the base, which is certainly the behavior of a barbarian.

Becoming overpowered may take a lot of time and effort, especially in online multiplayer, but prioritizing improvements to strength and vitality is a must, as well as finding or crafting strength-based armor and highly damaging weapons. Thralls can be used to assemble a small barbarian army, too – an imposing prospect.

item.title: Pokemon GO Fans Want Niantic to Add a New Item for Dynamax Pokemon
item.description:
Pokemon GO fans are asking Niantic to add a helpful item to the mobile monster-catching game, one that could provide a significant boost to players looking for Gigantamax Pokemon. The beloved monster-catching mobile game from Niantic has featured a wide variety of unique mechanics for its in-game creatures, mirroring plenty of the gimmicks found in the main-series games. The addition of Pokemon 's sixth generation to Pokemon GO brought with it the introduction of Mega Pokemon, while Pokemon GO 's recent focus on Galar added Dynamax Pokemon to the game. However, one particular Pokemon mechanic has proven quite elusive.

Gigantamax Pokemon were first introduced to Pokemon GO late last year, featuring some of the imposing boss Pokemon first appearing in Pokemon Sword and Shield . Players can only find Gigantamax variants of Pokemon through six-star Raid Battles within Pokemon GO , with the Gigantamax mechanic being exclusive to the game's "Max Battle" Raids. Pokemon GO currently features thirteen different Gigantamax Pokemon within its roster, including Gigantamax versions of both the Kanto and Galar Starters. Now, fans are asking Pokemon GO to make acquiring Gigantamax Pokemon a bit easier.

A post by Reddit user kiriito is proposing that Niantic should add a helpful new item for acquiring Gigantamax Pokemon in Pokemon GO . The post suggests that Niantic should introduce an item allowing trainers to convert their already-captured Dynamax Pokemon within Pokemon GO into their Gigantamax variants. The user specifically references one of their own Pokemon, with a shiny Toxtricity with nearly perfect stats that they would still feel inclined to sub for the Gigantamax variant. Other fans also suggested Niantic could add a similar item, potentially using the pre-existing Max Mushrooms, to give the ability to Dynamax to non-Dynamax Pokemon.

Pokemon GO Fans Want Niantic to Add Gigantamax Item

Replies to the post saw fans quickly pointing out an item with similar utility that already exists within the main-series Pokemon games. Pokemon Sword and Shield 's "Isle of Armor" expansion introduced Max Soup to the game, allowing players to upgrade their Pokemon to their Gigantamax versions. While many fans suggested that Niantic could implement a similar idea, others warned about the developer likely putting a premium price tag on the ability to upgrade a Pokemon to its Gigantamax variant.

The suggestion for improving Gigantamax Pokemon comes as Niantic could potentially be gearing up to introduce another major Pokemon gimmick. Recent leaks have suggested that, following the conclusion of Max Finale, Niantic is planning to add several ninth-generation Pokemon to Pokemon GO in the near future. The introduction of Pokemon like Ogerpon and Terapagos could potentially suggest that Pokemon Scarlet and Violet 's Terastal mechanic may soon be coming to Pokemon GO . Niantic and Pokemon GO look to have lots of exciting content on the way throughout the rest of 2025.
